title: Bay of Bengal Trough Brings Heavy Rain to South Tamil Nadu | November Alert - LiveChennai
article_text:
Bay of Bengal Trough Brings Heavy Rain to South Tamil Nadu | November Alert
Posted on: 07/Nov/2025 10:41:49 AM
Share
Previous
Next
 
 

The Bay of Bengal trough is expected to bring heavy rainfall to southern and interior districts of Tamil Nadu over the next two days. Stretching from the central Bay of Bengal to southern Kerala, this system is pulling moisture inland, increasing rainfall intensity.

Districts Under Alert:

Friday: Ramanathapuram, Sivagangai, Virudhunagar, Madurai, Theni, Dindigul

Saturday: Kanyakumari, Tirunelveli, Tenkasi, Thoothukudi

Residents are advised to stay cautious, avoid low-lying areas, and follow weather updates. Rainfall may continue intermittently until mid-November, with peak showers expected in southern districts after Sunday.

title: Monsoon Update – Heavy Rainfall and Thunderstorm Warning in 8 States, know forecast - Times Bull
article_text:
Monsoon Update – Continuous snowfall in the mountains has intensified the chill, worsening the situation. As soon as snowfall began in the higher reaches of Himachal Pradesh, tourists began arriving for recreation. Snowfall has also increased the cold in Uttarakhand and Kashmir.

Due to inclement weather in the southern and northeastern states, rain continues at various places. Thunderstorms and rain brought pleasant weather to many areas late last night. Strong winds have uprooted trees and damaged sugarcane crops. There is no hope of relief from the rain in these areas yet. Read the detailed report below to understand the weather conditions in these areas.

Heavy Rain Warning in These States

According to the Indian Meteorological Department, a heavy rain alert has been issued for several states in the next 24 hours. The IMD has issued an alert for heavy rain accompanied by thunderstorms in Kerala, Tamil Nadu, and Karnataka. In addition, heavy rain accompanied by thunderstorms has been predicted in the Andaman and Nicobar Islands.

Rainfall is also expected in several areas of Andhra Pradesh and Telangana. The IMD has forecast rain in several areas of Tripura, Mizoram, and Manipur. The situation is likely to continue to worsen here. While the rain will increase the cold, caution has been urged against lightning during this period.

Falling Temperatures in These States

According to the Meteorological Department, temperatures are falling in several states across the country. Snowfall in the mountains has increased the cold in Haryana and Punjab. Snowfall in the higher elevations in Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand, and Jammu and Kashmir, along with rising temperatures in the plains, has significantly increased the cold. Dense fog is also expected in western Uttar Pradesh due to falling temperatures.

Rainfall in Several Areas of Tamil Nadu

The Meteorological Department has predicted rain in several districts of Tamil Nadu. According to the IMD, heavy rain accompanied by lightning is likely in Tiruchirappalli, Krishnagiri, Vellore, Ranipet, Tirupattur, and Tiruvannamalai. In addition, Dharmapuri, Salem, Kallakurichi, Perambalur, and Ariyalur are likely to experience rain.

Pollution levels in Delhi NCR improve.

The haze and smoke that had enveloped Delhi NCR have now cleared, leading to improved air quality. Winter has also begun here, with temperatures dropping. Rain is not expected in the near future.
